cyclone.name: CLAUDETTE
cyclone.current_location: about 475 mi S of Morgan City, Louisiana
cyclone.trajectory: moving generally north across the west-central Gulf, then expected to turn northeast and cross the north-central Gulf Coast before accelerating inland across the southeast U.S.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the Louisiana coast between Intracoastal City and Morgan City

weather_observation.warning_coast: Intracoastal City, Louisiana, to the Alabama/Florida border including Lake Pontchartrain, Lake Maurepas, and Metropolitan New Orleans
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from coastal Louisiana eastward to the Alabama/Florida border
weather_observation.wind: Occasional tropical-storm-force gusts (generally <39 mph) possible in outer rainbands Friday night into Saturday
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge around 1 ft possible on the upper Texas coast during times of high tide
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer bands could bring 1â€“3 inches of rain with isolated higher pockets; localized street flooding possible
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous rip currents and elevated wave action along the Gulf beaches
